OOC:

Transformers don't have DNA... they use DNA scans to select an altern=
ate form but beyond that they're still technological life forms....wasn't t=
il BM that this fact was bastardized.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  Fr=
om: Jeepers Creepers 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, Janu=
ary 30, 2002 5:39 PM
  Subject: Re: All Read: Important


  I disagree with=
 that idea, because I intend on bring Skulletron back, because Menasor kept=
 some samples of his DNA.
    ----- Original Message ----- 
    From: Tanko=
r 
    To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
    Sent: Wednesday, January 30, 2002 12=
:25 PM
    Subject: Re: All Read: Important


    i got an idea once a char=
 is killed they dont come back 

      Jonathan <jhogan@...> =
wrote: 

      Anyway I was going to rant on about how a sequel wouldn't be=
 all that
      different from a restart but I figured why bother?

      W=
hen I hit the end of my long typed out rant I hit the problem. The real
   =
   one. Another person posted that characters are not allowed to die
      =
currently...he is utterly incorrect.

      The problem is the role-playing=
 101 aspect. People are given the
      responsibility to judge how much da=
mage they take...however as we've seen
      some can't role-play their way=
 out of a wet paper bag let alone responsibly
      judge how much damage t=
heir character takes. When a bot does get damaged
      what typically happ=
ens here?

      Here's the list:

      1) The enemy bot suddenly becomes =
cockeyed unable to hit the broad side of a
      barn even if he was a g1 a=
nd standing over it.

      2) The bot never gives chase to his prey. It al=
ways lets the long time
      character slip away.

      3) A short stay (=
a few hours usually) in the CR chamber and any damage is
      completely g=
one.

      4) The character "dies" but faked his death coming back as an e=
nemy
      infiltrator.

      5) Character "dies" but an evil clone appear=
s which after various meeting
      with colleagues or "loved ones" turns g=
ood again. Personality reverts to
      pre-evil clone.

      6) Character=
 "dies" but is reborn as a more powerful offspring. Personality
      is ha=
rdly different.

      7) Character "dies" but the players 6 other characte=
rs cart it's blasted
      carcass back to a lab where they resurrect him.
=

      8) Character "dies" replace with new bot same personality...eventual=
ly
      people will forget you died and you can go back to your old form.
=

      Since most will never let their "favorite" character(s) die, I mean =
truly
      die, never come back like, there's really very little new plotl=
ines you can
      do with them without repeating rehashed already done one=
s. Take for example
      the geotrons planing to attack the new cat factio=
n....both factions will
      survive, I doubt either player who controls t=
he majority of bots in either
      faction is gonna let their characters g=
et anywhere near killed.

      And what's to stop this from happening if a=
 restart/sequel DOES occur? The
      role-playing by some will still stink=
, characters will still be incapable of
      dying and given another year =
or so all plotlines for THAT game will be
      starting to repeat. While I=
 still do believe a restart/sequel is in order I
      think the role-playi=
ng problem needs addressing first to stop a repeat of
      what's happenin=
g to NBW.



      ----- Original Message -----
      From: "x_rauq_x" <x_r=
auq_x@...>
      To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
      Sent: Sunday, Jan=
uary 20, 2002 5:57 AM
      Subject: All Read: Important


      > My appol=
ogies, Narrator, I actually missed your original post.
      >
      > I fi=
nd that Neo Beast Wars has been dragged on for too long, and the
      > wo=
rld is becoming clogged with bases among other things. Ideas are
      > be=
coming exausted, if not completely exausted already. It seems to
      > me=
 that we are almost delaying the end of the rpg. If you've created
      > =
one storyline that you like, is it not fair to say that you can
      > cre=
ate another better one?
      >
      > The idea of creating a sequel to th=
e rpg is one that I would agree
      > with. That would require several th=
ings to happen:
      > 1) Changing the name of the RPG.
      > 2) Appropr=
iate changes to the website.
      > 3) A means to store all of everyone's =
previous characters (don't
      > know about everyone else, but I don't wa=
nt to lose the bio's of all
      > my characters).
      > 4) New story (i=
 have an idea, not necessarily for the story, but for
      > how we could =
create the story).
      > 5) A catalyst to start us all off (the story sho=
uld provide that).
      > 6) Implementation of new rules, some of which ha=
ve been, and are
      > being, discussed in the login messageboard.
      =
> 7) other stuff that could be written if I wasn't so tired.
      >
      =
> All in all, since there are more people voting anti-restart that I'd
    =
  > anticpated, I'll ask everyone a perhaps fate deciding question:
      >=

      > Would it be favourable to have a sequel instead of a restart?
    =
  >
      >
      >
      > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "airly2000" <airly2000@y...=
> wrote:
      > > I'm agree with Soulstice, restart isn't good idea. All h=
ave good
      > > story-lines and good characters. Perhaps the best would =
be
      > eliminate
      > > less importat characters of our story-line (=
every rpgers could
      > choice
      > > at whom wants eliminate) and el=
imitante factions where are member
      > > that aren't posting and join f=
actions that have few characters
      > > playing.
      > >
      > > Tha=
t other way than restart.
      > >
      > >
      > >
      > > --- In nb=
wrpg@y..., "Narrator" <thecode@p...> wrote:
      > > > OOC: I at first was=
n't sure if I could vote in this one. Not
      > only
      > > am I seemi=
ngly not too much an important part of this RPG, despite
      > > the gene=
ral current lack of members, and the fact that I've been
      > here
     =
 > > for getting close to 2 years, but also I am not involved in this
     =
 > > restart. I have very few characters. Characters that, if the RPG
     =
 > is
      > > restarted, will still be together (Insecticons, specificall=
y), and
      > > therefore it wouldn't harm me to vote yes. However, I don=
't think
      > I
      > > could vote yes, because I am apposed to restar=
ting the RPG. I have
      > > decided to vote no. It just doesn't make sen=
se to me to end the
      > saga
      > > of Neo Beast Wars. It's a great =
saga that we've worked hard over
      > the
      > > years to keep going.=
 I don't think that we could suddenly pretend
      > it
      > > never ha=
ppened, I think it's impossible. Maybe if we ended it and
      > > started=
 the sequel, I wouldn't mind so much, but otherwise, my
      > vote
      =
> > is no. Thank you for reading this if you even did...
      > >
